subject: Quantum Mechanics 2
title: Quantum Mechanics 2 (TUM, Module NAT3001)
description: Path integrals (classical/semiclassical limit, Aharonov–Bohm), open quantum systems (density matrices, Lindblad, decoherence), identical particles and second quantization, Klein–Gordon and Dirac equations, relativistic corrections (spin–orbit, Darwin, Lamb shift), and molecular Born–Oppenheimer/van der Waals (time permitting). Workload 150 h (90 h contact), 5 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Brambilla, Nora. Language: EN/DE.

goals.title: Quantum Mechanics 2 – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner can handle path integrals, open-system dynamics, second quantization for identical particles, relativistic one-particle equations, and key relativistic corrections, with awareness of decoherence and molecular approximations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can handle path integrals, open-system dynamics, second quantization for identical particles, relativistic one-particle equations, and key relativistic corrections, with awareness of decoherence and molecular approximations.

goals.title: Path Integral & Semiclassics
goals.description: Learner can set up path integrals, connect to classical/semiclassical limits, and explain the Aharonov–Bohm effect.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can set up path integrals, connect to classical/semiclassical limits, and explain the Aharonov–Bohm effect.

goals.title: Open Quantum Systems
goals.description: Learner can use density matrices, von Neumann/Lindblad equations, and discuss decoherence including two-level systems.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can use density matrices, von Neumann/Lindblad equations, and discuss decoherence including two-level systems.

goals.title: Identical Particles & Second Quantization
goals.description: Learner can formulate bosonic/fermionic systems with Fock space, second quantization, and interpret one-/multi-particle operators and field operators.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can formulate bosonic/fermionic systems with Fock space, second quantization, and interpret one-/multi-particle operators and field operators.

goals.title: Relativistic Wave Equations
goals.description: Learner can derive/solve Klein–Gordon and Dirac equations, discuss operators (Hamiltonian, momentum, charge current) and couplings to electromagnetism.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can derive/solve Klein–Gordon and Dirac equations, discuss operators (Hamiltonian, momentum, charge current) and couplings to electromagnetism.

goals.title: Dirac Spectrum & Hydrogen
goals.description: Learner can compute the Dirac energy spectrum for hydrogen and relate it to gyromagnetic ratio and Pauli equation limits.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can compute the Dirac energy spectrum for hydrogen and relate it to gyromagnetic ratio and Pauli equation limits.

goals.title: Relativistic Corrections
goals.description: Learner can derive nonrelativistic expansions (spin–orbit, Darwin term, Lamb shift) and interpret their spectral effects.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can derive nonrelativistic expansions (spin–orbit, Darwin term, Lamb shift) and interpret their spectral effects.

goals.title: Field Quantization
goals.description: Learner can quantize electromagnetic, Klein–Gordon and Dirac fields, and use number/occupation representations in Fock space.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can quantize electromagnetic, Klein–Gordon and Dirac fields, and use number/occupation representations in Fock space.

goals.title: Molecular States (Optional)
goals.description: Learner understands Born–Oppenheimer approximation and van der Waals forces for molecular states (if time permits).
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands Born–Oppenheimer approximation and van der Waals forces for molecular states (if time permits).

Workload 150 h (90 h contact), 5 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Brambilla, Nora. Language: EN/DE.
